name: CommunicatingDevice
description: A type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The communicating communicating device is a medical communicating device
purpose: Allows institutions to track their devices.

element.definition: A type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The communicating communicating device is a medical communicating device.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a communicating device by manufacturers other organizations or owners.
element.comment: The barcode string from a barcode present on a communicating device label or package may identify the instance, include names given to the communicating device in local usage, or may identify the type of CommunicatingDevice. If the identifier identifies the type of communicating device, CommunicatingDevice.type element should be used.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: The serial number which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.   The identifier.type code should be set to “SNO”(Serial Number) and the system left empty.

element.short: The reference to the definition for the communicating device
element.definition: The reference to the definition for the CommunicatingDevice.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique communicating device identifier (UDI) assigned to communicating device label or package.  Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.
element.comment: UDI may identify an unique instance of a communicating device, or it may only identify the type of the CommunicatingDevice.  See [UDI mappings](device-mappings.html#udi) for a complete mapping of UDI parts to CommunicatingDevice.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The communicating device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a CommunicatingDevice.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: The communicating device identifier (DI), a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a CommunicatingDevice.

element.definition:
Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices.  For example, the US FDA issuers include :
1) GS1: 
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 
4) ICCBA for other devices:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map:
All UDIs are to be issued under a system operated by an Jurisdiction-accredited issuing agency.
GS1 DIs: 
 http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1
HIBCC DIs:
 http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc
ICCBBA DIs for blood containers:
 http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood
ICCBA DIs for other devices:
 http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other

element.definition: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a  jurisdiction.  All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system.  For example,  UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is  http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/fda-udi.
element.requirements: Allows a recipient of a UDI to know which database will contain the UDI-associated metadata.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the communicating device - e.g., a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.
element.comment: The AIDC form of UDIs should be scanned or otherwise used for the identification of the communicating device whenever possible to minimize errors in records resulting from manual transcriptions. If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: A unique communicating device identifier (UDI) on a communicating device label a form that uses automatic identification and data capture (AIDC) technology.

element.definition: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the communicating device.
element.comment: If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: A unique communicating device identifier (UDI) on a communicating device label in plain text

element.definition: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.
element.requirements: Supports a way to distinguish hand entered from machine read data.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes to identify how UDI data was entered.

element.definition: Status of the Device availability.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes inactive and entered-in-error that mark the communicating device (record)as not currently valid.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: The availability status of the communicating device.

element.short: online | paused | standby | offline | not-ready | transduc-discon | hw-discon | off
element.definition: Reason for the dtatus of the Device availability.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The availability status reason of the communicating device.

element.definition: The distinct identification string as required by regulation for a human cell, tissue, or cellular and tissue-based product.
element.comment: For example, this applies to devices in the United States regulated under *Code of Federal Regulation 21CFR§1271.290(c)*.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: The lot or batch number within which a communicating device was manufactured - which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.

element.definition: A name of the manufacturer.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Date when the communicating device was made
element.definition: The date and time when the communicating device was manufactured.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: The date a specific communicating device was manufactured - which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.  For FHIR, The datetime syntax must converted to YYYY-MM-DD[THH:MM:SS].  If hour is present, the minutes and seconds should both be set to “00”.

element.short: Date and time of expiry of this communicating device (if applicable)
element.definition: The date and time beyond which this communicating device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: the expiration date of a specific communicating device -  which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.  For FHIR, The datetime syntax must converted to YYYY-MM-DD[THH:MM:SS].  If hour is present, the minutes and seconds should both be set to “00”.

element.definition: Lot number assigned by the manufacturer.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: The lot or batch number within which a communicating device was manufactured - which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.

element.short: Serial number assigned by the manufacturer
element.definition: The serial number assigned by the organization when the communicating device was manufactured.
element.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The name of the communicating device as given by the manufacturer
element.definition: This represents the manufacturer's name of the communicating device as provided by the communicating device, from a UDI label, or by a person describing the CommunicatingDevice.  This typically would be used when a person provides the name(s) or when the communicating device represents one of the names available from DeviceDefinition.

element.definition: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical communicating device.  For example devices containing latex.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The parent communicating device.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The communicating device may be a medical or non-medical communicating device.
Unique instance identifiers assigned to a communicating device by manufacturers other organizations or owners.
element.comment: The barcode string from a barcode present on a communicating device label or package may identify the instance, include names given to the communicating device in local usage, or may identify the type of communicating device. If the identifier identifies the type of communicating device, CommunicatingDevice.type element should be used.

mapping.map: The serial number which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.   The identifier.type code should be set to “SNO”(Serial Number) and the system left empty.

element.short: The reference to the definition for the communicating device
element.definition: The reference to the definition for the communicating device.

Unique communicating device identifier (UDI) assigned to communicating device label or package.  Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.
element.comment: UDI may identify an unique instance of a communicating device, or it may only identify the type of the communicating device.  See [UDI mappings](device-mappings.html#udi) for a complete mapping of UDI parts to CommunicatingDevice.

element.definition: The communicating device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a communicating device.

mapping.map: The communicating device identifier (DI), a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a communicating device.

element.definition:
Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices.  For example, the US FDA issuers include :
1) GS1: 
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 
4) ICCBA for other devices:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di.

mapping.map:
All UDIs are to be issued under a system operated by an Jurisdiction-accredited issuing agency.
GS1 DIs: 
 http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1
HIBCC DIs:
 http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc
ICCBBA DIs for blood containers:
 http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood
ICCBA DIs for other devices:
 http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other

element.definition: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a  jurisdiction.  All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system.  For example,  UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is  http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/fda-udi.
element.requirements: Allows a recipient of a UDI to know which database will contain the UDI-associated metadata.

element.definition: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the communicating device - e.g., a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.
element.comment: The AIDC form of UDIs should be scanned or otherwise used for the identification of the communicating device whenever possible to minimize errors in records resulting from manual transcriptions. If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

mapping.map: A unique communicating device identifier (UDI) on a communicating device label a form that uses automatic identification and data capture (AIDC) technology.

element.definition: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the communicating device.
element.comment: If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

mapping.map: A unique communicating device identifier (UDI) on a communicating device label in plain text

element.definition: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.
element.requirements: Supports a way to distinguish hand entered from machine read data.

binding.description: Codes to identify how UDI data was entered.

element.definition: Status of the Communicating Device availability.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes inactive and entered-in-error that mark the communicating device (record)as not currently valid.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: The availability status of the communicating device.

element.short: online | paused | standby | offline | not-ready | transduc-discon | hw-discon | off
element.definition: Reason for the dtatus of the Device availability.

binding.description: The availability status reason of the communicating device.

element.definition: The distinct identification string as required by regulation for a human cell, tissue, or cellular and tissue-based product.
element.comment: For example, this applies to devices in the United States regulated under *Code of Federal Regulation 21CFR§1271.290(c)*.

mapping.map: The lot or batch number within which a communicating device was manufactured - which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.

element.definition: A name of the manufacturer.

element.short: Date when the communicating device was made
element.definition: The date and time when the communicating device was manufactured.

mapping.map: The date a specific communicating device was manufactured - which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.  For FHIR, The datetime syntax must converted to YYYY-MM-DD[THH:MM:SS].  If hour is present, the minutes and seconds should both be set to “00”.

element.short: Date and time of expiry of this communicating device (if applicable)
element.definition: The date and time beyond which this communicating device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable).

mapping.map: the expiration date of a specific communicating device -  which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.  For FHIR, The datetime syntax must converted to YYYY-MM-DD[THH:MM:SS].  If hour is present, the minutes and seconds should both be set to “00”.

element.definition: Lot number assigned by the manufacturer.

mapping.map: The lot or batch number within which a communicating device was manufactured - which is a component of the production identifier (PI), a conditional, variable portion of a UDI.

element.short: Serial number assigned by the manufacturer
element.definition: The serial number assigned by the organization when the communicating device was manufactured.
element.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

element.short: The name of the communicating device as given by the manufacturer
element.definition: This represents the manufacturer's name of the communicating device as provided by the communicating device, from a UDI label, or by a person describing the CommunicatingDevice.  This typically would be used when a person provides the name(s) or when the communicating device represents one of the names available from DeviceDefinition.

element.short: The name of the communicating device
element.definition: The name of the communicating device.

element.short: udi-label-name | user-friendly-name | patient-reported-name | manufacturer-name | model-name | other
element.definition:
The type of deviceName.
UDILabelName | UserFriendlyName | PatientReportedName | ManufactureDeviceName | ModelName.

binding.description: The type of name the communicating device is referred by.

element.short: The model number for the communicating device
element.definition: The model number for the communicating device.

element.short: The part number of the communicating device
element.definition: The part number of the communicating device.
element.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

element.short: The kind or type of communicating device
element.definition: The kind or type of communicating device.

element.short: The capabilities supported on a  communicating device, the standards to which the communicating device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication
element.definition: The capabilities supported on a  communicating device, the standards to which the communicating device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication.

element.short: The standard that is used to operate and communicate
element.definition: The standard that is used to operate and communicate.

element.short: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate
element.definition: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate.

element.short: The actual design of the communicating device or software version running on the communicating device
element.definition: The actual design of the communicating device or software version running on the communicating device.

element.short: The type of the communicating device version
element.definition: The type of the communicating device version.

element.short: A single component of the communicating device version
element.definition: A single component of the communicating device version.
The version text.

element.short: The actual configuration settings of a communicating device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties
element.definition: The actual configuration settings of a communicating device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties.

element.short: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible)
element.definition: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible).
Property value as a quantity.

element.short: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP)
element.definition: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP).

element.short: Patient to whom Device is affixed
element.definition: Patient information, If the communicating device is affixed to a person.
element.requirements: If the communicating device is implanted in a patient, then need to associate the communicating device to the patient.

element.definition: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the communicating device.
Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the communicating device.
element.comment: used for troubleshooting etc.

element.short: Where the communicating device is found
element.definition: The place where the communicating device can be found.
element.requirements: CommunicatingDevice.location can be used to track communicating device location.

element.short: Network address to contact communicating device
element.definition: A network address on which the communicating device may be contacted directly.
element.comment: If the communicating device is running a FHIR server, the network address should  be the Base URL from which a conformance statement may be retrieved.

element.definition: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.
Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical communicating device.  For example devices containing latex.
The parent communicating device.
